semanticPatch.suggestedFixDescription: electron-store uses [ajv](https://github.com/ajv-validator/ajv) to validate the schema option parsed to the constructor as `new Store({schema});`. Updating ajv to version 8 introduces the change of wording from using “should” to now using the word “must”. This could potentially be breaking for some users relying on the wording being identical when an error is thrown. Since this is the only breaking change for electron-store version 8, we recommend updating and then making what should be a rather simple fix if your pipeline were to break.
semanticPatch.unknownAccessPathQuestion: Is this a constructor call from the electron-store package?
